battleship2000.programlogic

Class GameCommands

  • java.lang.Object
    • battleship2000.programlogic.GameCommands

  • public class GameCommands
extends Object
    A class used by the user interface package to communicate with the program logic package.

    This class is responsible for storing the BattleShipGame object and allowing interaction with it from the user interface.

    Author:
    Petri Kallio

    • Method Detail

      • createANewGame

        public void createANewGame()
        Creates a new BattleShipGame object and sets it as an object variable.

      • setShipOnTable

        public boolean setShipOnTable(Ship ship,
                     int x,
                     int y)
        Checks if a ship can be placed on the player's game table on the coordinates given as parameters and places it if possible.

        The ShipPlacement responsible for positioning the ships on a GameTable will first check if the ship can be placed to the given coordinates and returns a boolean value according to the result.

        Parameters:
        ship - the Ship object to be placed
        x - the first ship part's x-coordinate
        y - the first ship part's y-coordinate
        Returns:
        true if the ship was placed on the table, false otherwise
        See Also:
        battleship2000.programlogic.control.ShipPlacement#setShipsPosition(int, int)}

      • getGame

        public BattleShipGame getGame()

      • playerReadyToStart

        public void playerReadyToStart()
        Tells the game that the user is ready to begin the game.

        This method calls for the computerSetShips() method and subsequently starts the game with the startGame() method.

        See Also:
        computerSetShips(), startGame()

      • playOneRound

        public void playOneRound(Square usersChoice)
        Creates a new PlayOneRound object that handles one turns events.
